issue.body:

I encounter this somewhat often (regularly enough to be an annoyance). I remember a non-sponsored site also not working another time due to in-between tracking URLs, but I don't recall which page so have no proof of it ever happening. > > In my opinion, if an ad (or sponsored search result, which I have enabled in my AdGuard settings) shows up it should also work. The g2a website itself is not blocked, it is just one or more tracking pages in between that are. Username: `@Hedge4` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ke9aljl765cksks8so4wcws8oc4gwswq35ymae6ni8.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/eno7c2xk81kw44goosgoc4kggc0ogokoxzhopng0kg.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ge58h2crtjww0k4sskocow8ckc8wos05nx0uwdi6tk.png?nc=1)

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Getting rid of JS rules, used to set a cookie

labels.name: Infrastructure
labels.description: Related to the repository infrastructure

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

We have ~317 JS rules, used to set a cookie. They can be found by:
`document.cookie =`
They must be replaced by `set-cookie` / `set-cookie-reload` / `trusted-set-cookie-reload` scriptlet rules.

There are many old rules, so first you need to check if the site is available, and then the need for the rule.

* For convenience, you can work in a separate browser
* Retrieve the list of domains, clean up duplicates and check if sites exist (if redirects occur, we assume that the site is dead).
* All such rules can be merged into one file, convert them to exception rules and import as custom filter. Then go down the list and check if the rules are needed (other types of problems not related to these rules are skipped).
* If the site is dead - add domains in the comment below. Then we will remove them from the filters.

In order not to overlap with other filter maintainers, it is desirable to perform batch rule replacement via pull-requests (5-10 rules per PR).

### Important
It should be checked with a Dutch or German VPN, because otherwise the cookie usage messages may not appear.

comment.body:
Not reproduced with AdGuard filters on my end.
Try to leave only AdGuard filters below without other extensions, clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).
```
AdGuard Base
AdGuard Tracking Protection
AdGuard Annoyances
AdGuard Chinese
```

comment.body:
Blocking Google Analytics... fine. But come on, our very own pixel that I have developed myself doesn't track anyone, it doesn't even use cookies. As explained in our privacy policy, we only collect aggregated metrics (daily number of page impressions per article, user-agent, etc). ComputerBase is a small independent publisher and we need some aggregated metrics to work with. This has nothing to do with "tracking".

(Furthermore, please consider that Firefox will become even more irrelevant for web developers if it becomes completely invisible in [charts like these](https://www.computerbase.de/2024-09/chrome-firefox-etc-welche-browser-nutzt-ihr-bei-computer-und-smartphone/). And I think we all agree that Firefox is important for a healthy web.)

When at some point in the future there is nothing left but paid subscriptions and AI-generated crap you might come to realize that what you participated in was sometimes a little over-the-top.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Actually, I can't reproduce it after solving the captcha. I see that you mentioned this rule `@@||skyscanner.co.kr/*/xhr/assets/js/bundle$stealth` and that it causes by the `Hide your User-Agent`.
Please check this.
```adblock
@@||skyscanner.co.kr/*/xhr/assets/js/bundle$stealth=useragent
```

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.photopea.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.photopea.com%2F) ### Comment > Create two projects using File > New so that there are two tabs open. When you export one tab (File > Export as > PNG) I cannot open the second tab. I'm not sure if anything else on the website breaks but that definitely does, happens on Chrome too. I figure AdGuard is blocking something core to the sites functions. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Not sure if that domain should be unblocked as it's a known adserver.
I see that you use `System` DNS, so in that case you can unblock it by adding a rule below to DNS user rules.
```adblock
@@||ad.doubleclick.net^|
```

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/184282

comment.body:
Не повторяется с вашими настройками.
Попробуйте выключить и снова включить контент-блокеры в настройках Сафари, а также обновить фильтры Адгарда.
Важно не закрывать окно Адгарда при обновлении фильтров в течение ~90 секунд, иначе iOS прервёт процесс применения фильтров.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.ebay.com/itm/296782477028](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ebay.com%2Fitm%2F296782477028) ### Comment > I'm using AdGuard for Windows, installed system-wide with HTTPS filtering enabled. This problem presents in all browsers I've tried. Specifically: > > With "AdGuard Base Filter" ENABLED, the site actively obfuscates the circled promotional elements inside random named DOM elements, shadow roots, etc. > > With "AdGuard Base Filter" DISABLED these same elements are in easy-to-filter DOM elements. > > User rules or userscripts that hide the unwanted elements break when the Base FIlter is active. I have not been able to identify what item(s) in the base filter are triggering eBay to obfuscate the content. Perhaps someone more experienced can solve this... Username: `@kriswilk` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Не повторяется.
Попробуйте оставить только фильтры AdGuard, очистить данные браузера, обновить фильтры (подождите около одной минуты), затем откройте сайт.
Если это не поможет, вам следует повторно включить блокировщики контента (веб расширения) в настройках Safari (подождите примерно столько же времени, сколько и при обновлении фильтров).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.ebay.com/itm/296782477028](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ebay.com%2Fitm%2F296782477028) ### Comment > I'm using AdGuard for Windows, installed system-wide with HTTPS filtering enabled. This problem presents in all browsers I've tried. Specifically: > > With "AdGuard Base Filter" ENABLED, the site actively obfuscates the circled promotional elements inside random named DOM elements, shadow roots, etc. > > With "AdGuard Base Filter" DISABLED these same elements are in easy-to-filter DOM elements. > > User rules or userscripts that hide the unwanted elements break when the Base FIlter is active. I have not been able to identify what item(s) in the base filter are triggering eBay to obfuscate the content. Perhaps someone more experienced can solve this... Username: `@kriswilk` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/7vmmelw6g38co4o4k80ooosoow84ockn3p3iy7o6hc.png?nc=1)

issue.title: m.inven.co.kr

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# 죄송합니다. 해당 웹 사이트는 애드쉴드(AdShield, Inc)에 의해 감염되었습니다.

안타깝게도 이 웹 사이트는 안티 애드블록 전문 회사인 애드쉴드의 서비스에 의해 보호받고 있어 일반적인 애드블록 규칙로는 처리가 까다롭습니다.
애드쉴드는 대한민국 정부의 기술 창업 지원 프로그램으로부터 최대 2년에 7억원을 받습니다.

이러한 기록은 [여기](https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues?q=label%3Aad-shield+)에서 검증하실 수 있습니다.
대한민국 정부의 지원 사실은 [여기](https://www.venturesquare.net/857777)에서 확인하실 수 있습니다.

## 유저스크립트 설치
[microShield 유저스크립트](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield)를 설치하여 애드쉴드 광고를 차단하시길 바랍니다.
한국어로 작성되어 있는 설치 가이드라인은 [이 URL](https://community.list-kr.com/docs/AdGuard/Userscripts/microShield)를 방문하여 확인해주세요.


## 그래도 문제가 있으신가요?
유저스크립트를 사용했을 때 발생하는 문제는 [이 이슈 트래커](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/issues)로 알려주세요.
기타 문제는 [이 곳](https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues)으로 알려주세요.
GitHub 이슈를 사용하시기 어렵다면, filters@adguard.com 로 문의해주세요.

Do not close AdGuard window ~90 seconds, because iOS will break configuration process.

issue.title: m.ygosu.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

labels.name: List-KR
labels.description: Problematic issues, handled in List-KR

issue.body:
# 죄송합니다. 해당 웹 사이트는 애드쉴드(AdShield, Inc)에 의해 감염되었습니다.

안타깝게도 이 웹 사이트는 안티 애드블록 전문 회사인 애드쉴드의 서비스에 의해 보호받고 있어 일반적인 애드블록 규칙로는 처리가 까다롭습니다.
애드쉴드는 대한민국 정부의 기술 창업 지원 프로그램으로부터 최대 2년에 7억원을 받습니다.

이러한 기록은 [여기](https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues?q=label%3Aad-shield+)에서 검증하실 수 있습니다.
대한민국 정부의 지원 사실은 [여기](https://www.venturesquare.net/857777)에서 확인하실 수 있습니다.

## 유저스크립트 설치
[microShield 유저스크립트](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield)를 설치하여 애드쉴드 광고를 차단하시길 바랍니다.
한국어로 작성되어 있는 설치 가이드라인은 [이 URL](https://community.list-kr.com/docs/AdGuard/Userscripts/microShield)를 방문하여 확인해주세요.


## 그래도 문제가 있으신가요?
유저스크립트를 사용했을 때 발생하는 문제는 [이 이슈 트래커](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/issues)로 알려주세요.
기타 문제는 [이 곳](https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues)으로 알려주세요.
GitHub 이슈를 사용하시기 어렵다면, filters@adguard.com 로 문의해주세요.

### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.ebay.com/itm/296782477028](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ebay.com%2Fitm%2F296782477028) ### Comment > I'm using AdGuard for Windows, installed system-wide with HTTPS filtering enabled. This problem presents in all browsers I've tried. Specifically: > > With "AdGuard Base Filter" ENABLED, the site actively obfuscates the circled promotional elements inside random named DOM elements, shadow roots, etc. > > With "AdGuard Base Filter" DISABLED these same elements are in easy-to-filter DOM elements. > > User rules or userscripts that hide the unwanted elements break when the Base FIlter is active. I have not been able to identify what item(s) in the base filter are triggering eBay to obfuscate the content. Perhaps someone more experienced can solve this... Username: `@kriswilk` ### Screenshots

AdGuard Base Browsing Security: | enabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled Userscripts: | disabled Userstyles: | disabled Other extensions used: | Bitwarden, ViolentMonkey ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ebay.com%2Fitm%2F296782477028)

comment.body:
This is NOT resolved.

@Alex-302, I did not explain my problem clearly enough. Follow these steps precisely to observe/reproduce it. I have provided screenshots demonstrating the appearance and underlying HTML structure at each stage.

The key is Step 10, where disabling "AdGuard Base Filter" allows my custom user rule to block the content. The presence of "AdGuard Base Filter" is causing the breakage. Conducting the same test with the same user rule in uBO has no such problem using their base filter(s).

TO REPRODUCE:

1. Make sure there are NO user rules
2. Make sure "AdGuard Base FIlter" is ENABLED
3. DISABLE AdGuard
4. Visit https://www.ebay.com/itm/186333967862 ... promoted content exists within a `<div>` with class `x-rx-slot`

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 092939](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3e816171-fa2f-4d03-b1ce-7d0228dbc998)

</details>

6. ENABLE AdGuard
7. Reload the test page ... promoted content still exists within a `<div>` with class `x-rx-slot`

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 093042](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8f3122af-82c6-428e-80b3-2e8217a2d3cc)

</details>

8. Now create a user rule `ebay.*##.x-rx-slot`
9. Reload the test page ... promoted content is now obfuscated, no longer with class `x-rx-slot`

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 093207](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/87f44280-67df-4709-9f0b-70d43e1fa1b9)

</details>

10. TURN OFF the "AdGuard Base Filter"
11. Reload the test page ... the promoted content is blocked perfectly by the user rule

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 093732](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9c5dda30-da2d-4945-88a0-2423830794f9)

</details>

I trust that this clarifies the problem?

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/184282

issue.title: AdGuard Base Filter breaks user rules at www.ebay.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard DNS, AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

7.19.0.4853

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.ebay.com/itm/186333967862 (or any other live listing)

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

AdGuard DNS filter

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

_Issue #192269 was closed without resolving the actual problem. I don't know if maintainers will see my subsequent comments there, so I created this much more detailed issue report._

### SUMMARY

Particular user rules for www.ebay.com break only when the "AdGuard Base Filter" is enabled.

Follow the steps below to reproduce the issue. Conducting the same test with the same user rule in uBO works fine. This is specific to AdGuard Base Filter.

### STEPS TO REPRODUCE:

1. Make sure there are NO user rules
2. Make sure "AdGuard Base FIlter" is ENABLED
3. DISABLE AdGuard
4. Visit https://www.ebay.com/itm/186333967862 ... promoted content exists within a `<div>` with class `x-rx-slot`

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 092939](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3e816171-fa2f-4d03-b1ce-7d0228dbc998)

</details>

5. ENABLE AdGuard
6. Reload the test page ... promoted content still exists within a `<div>` with class `x-rx-slot`

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 093042](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8f3122af-82c6-428e-80b3-2e8217a2d3cc)

</details>

7. Now create a user rule `ebay.*##.x-rx-slot`
8. Reload the test page ... promoted content is now obfuscated, no longer with class `x-rx-slot`

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 093207](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/87f44280-67df-4709-9f0b-70d43e1fa1b9)

</details>

9. TURN OFF the "AdGuard Base Filter"
10. Reload the test page ... the promoted content is blocked perfectly by the user rule

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 093732](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9c5dda30-da2d-4945-88a0-2423830794f9)

</details>

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: www.petitfute.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [microShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/blob/main/README.md).


## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/issues).
Please report to [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/166924) if other issue.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.abola.pt/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.abola.pt%2F) ### Comment > There is no visible difference in the website, hence the screenshot is the same for both versions. But nothing works. Every section on the website should be clickable and open a detail view of what has been clicked, however clicking anywhere with AdGuard enabled doesn't open anything. Oddly enough, with middle click or right click + open in new tab works. Just the normal left click doesn't. ### Screenshots

issue.title: AdGuard Base Filter breaks user rules at www.ebay.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard DNS, AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

7.19.0.4853

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.ebay.com/itm/186333967862 (or any other live listing)

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

AdGuard DNS filter

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

_Issue #192269 was closed without resolving the actual problem. I don't know if maintainers will see my subsequent comments there, so I created this much more detailed issue report._

### SUMMARY

Particular user rules for www.ebay.com break only when the "AdGuard Base Filter" is enabled.

Follow the steps below to reproduce the issue. Conducting the same test with the same user rule in uBO works fine. This is specific to AdGuard Base Filter.

### STEPS TO REPRODUCE:

1. Make sure there are NO user rules
2. Make sure "AdGuard Base FIlter" is ENABLED
3. DISABLE AdGuard
4. Visit https://www.ebay.com/itm/186333967862 ... promoted content exists within a `<div>` with class `x-rx-slot`

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 092939](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3e816171-fa2f-4d03-b1ce-7d0228dbc998)

</details>

5. ENABLE AdGuard
6. Reload the test page ... promoted content still exists within a `<div>` with class `x-rx-slot`

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 093042](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8f3122af-82c6-428e-80b3-2e8217a2d3cc)

</details>

7. Now create a user rule `ebay.*##.x-rx-slot`
8. Reload the test page ... promoted content is now obfuscated, no longer with class `x-rx-slot`

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 093207](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/87f44280-67df-4709-9f0b-70d43e1fa1b9)

</details>

9. TURN OFF the "AdGuard Base Filter"
10. Reload the test page ... the promoted content is blocked perfectly by the user rule

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 093732](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9c5dda30-da2d-4945-88a0-2423830794f9)

</details>

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: Update available in about 3-4 hours.

issue.title: Remove filter for "useful" content at ebay.*
issue.body:
Issue #192475 was addressed by @BlazDT in https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/167a7b0f6659ee9500d9fa53c23963d09bf1e472. That commit:

- adds anti-adblock entries (thank you!!)

but also

- adds a filter for the unwanted content that I was targeting
- adds a "usefulads" exclusion for the same content

Since many users probably enjoy using the "similar items" and "you may also like..." sections, this should NOT be the default behaviour.

For that reason, this PR removes the filter rule and its "usefulads" counterpart. The anti-adblock component was all that was required to solve the original issue.

comment.body:
> They are sponsored. So if a user wants to see them just enable useful ads filter

OK. In that case, may I suggest a more complete set of filters that strip out obvious sponsored content from eBay? This is what I use:

```
! ebay listings - promoted content carousels
ebay.*##.x-rx-slot
ebay.*##.x-rx-slot-btf
! ebay search results - picked for you, related searches
ebay.*##.srp-river-answer
ebay.*##.srp-main-below-river
```

Can you add these, or shall I make a new PR?

issue.title: ebay.com adblock detection

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard DNS, AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

7.19.0.4853

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.ebay.com/itm/186333967862 (or any other live listing)

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

AdGuard DNS filter

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

_Issue #192269 was closed without resolving the actual problem. I don't know if maintainers will see my subsequent comments there, so I created this much more detailed issue report._

### SUMMARY

Particular user rules for www.ebay.com break only when the "AdGuard Base Filter" is enabled.

Follow the steps below to reproduce the issue. Conducting the same test with the same user rule in uBO works fine. This is specific to AdGuard Base Filter.

### STEPS TO REPRODUCE:

1. Make sure there are NO user rules
2. Make sure "AdGuard Base FIlter" is ENABLED
3. DISABLE AdGuard
4. Visit https://www.ebay.com/itm/186333967862 ... promoted content exists within a `<div>` with class `x-rx-slot`

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 092939](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3e816171-fa2f-4d03-b1ce-7d0228dbc998)

</details>

5. ENABLE AdGuard
6. Reload the test page ... promoted content still exists within a `<div>` with class `x-rx-slot`

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 093042](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8f3122af-82c6-428e-80b3-2e8217a2d3cc)

</details>

7. Now create a user rule `ebay.*##.x-rx-slot`
8. Reload the test page ... promoted content is now obfuscated, no longer with class `x-rx-slot`

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 093207](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/87f44280-67df-4709-9f0b-70d43e1fa1b9)

</details>

9. TURN OFF the "AdGuard Base Filter"
10. Reload the test page ... the promoted content is blocked perfectly by the user rule

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Screenshot 2024-11-07 093732](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9c5dda30-da2d-4945-88a0-2423830794f9)

</details>

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
@BlazDT I suggest removing the filter for the specific content I was targeting. That content is likely useful to many users. I submitted PR #192487 to address this.

The anti-adblock fix is perfect. I've tested it already by adding the rules manually and it works. 👍

pull_request.title: Remove filter for "useful" content at ebay.*
pull_request.body:
Issue #192475 was addressed by @BlazDT in https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/167a7b0f6659ee9500d9fa53c23963d09bf1e472. That commit:

- adds anti-adblock entries (thank you!!)

but also

- adds a filter for the unwanted content that I was targeting
- adds a "usefulads" exclusion for the same content

Since many users probably enjoy using the "similar items" and "you may also like..." sections, this should NOT be the default behaviour.

For that reason, this PR removes the filter rule and its "usefulads" counterpart. The anti-adblock component was all that was required to solve the original issue.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
